/* Set height of top bar (this was 3rem) */
.tc-topbar  {

table.plain { border: 0 !important; width: 100% !important; text-align: left !important; border-collapse: collapse !important; margin-left:15px !important; }

table.plain tr:nth-child(odd) { background: transparent; } table.plain tr:nth-child(even) { background: transparent; }

table.plain td, table.plain th { border: 0 !important; vertical-align:top !important; padding: 3px 2px !important; } table.plain tbody td { font-size: 13px !important; vertical-align:top !important; }

table.cls {
  font-size: 12px  !important;
  min-width: 75%;
}
table.cls td, table.cls th {
  border: 1px solid #dcdcdc !important;
  vertical-align:top !important;
  padding: 3px 2px !important;
}

table.realplain { border: 0 !important; width: 100% !important; text-align: left !important; border-collapse: collapse !important;  margin-left:0px !important; margin-top:0px !important; margin-bottom:0px !important; padding-left: 0px !important; padding-right: 0px !important; padding-top: 0px !important; padding-bottom: 0px !important; box-sizing: no}

table.realplain tr:nth-child(odd) { background: transparent; } table.realplain tr:nth-child(even) { background: transparent; }

table.realplain td, table.realplain th { border: 0 !important; vertical-align:top !important;  } table.realplain tbody td { vertical-align:top !important; }



/* Set the MAP modal dialogs (more left and towards the top) to make better use of the screen) */
.tc-modal { top: 4rem; !important;
	right: auto !important;
	left: 15% !important;
}

/* the color picker in the MAP product does not render properly */
.vis-color-picker { min-width: 310px !important;}

/* hide bottom bar, if present lower the z-index */
#navigator-main {
  z-index: 49 !important;
  display:none !important; 
}

/* set the z-order of the sidebar (default is 1500) this is needed to see Maps dialogs */
.tc-sidebar-scrollable { z-index: 30 !important }

.leaflet-container { z-index: 1 !important; }

/* Set height of top bar (this was 3rem) */
.tc-topbar { max-height: 40px !important; }

/* Colour of title in tiddler */
h2.tc-title {
   color: <> !important;
}


.boxes * { margin: 0; padding: 0; width:100% display: flex; }

.boxes ul { padding-top: 20px; position: relative; transition: all 0.5s; -webkit-transition: all 0.5s; -moz-transition: all 0.5s; display: flex; }

.boxes li { float: left; text-align: center; list-style-type: none; position: relative; border: 1px solid #ccc; margin:5px; padding: 5px 10px; text-decoration: none; display: inline-block;

transition: all 0.5s; -webkit-transition: all 0.5s; -moz-transition: all 0.5s; }

.boxes li a { display: inline-block; text-decoration: none; /* disgiuse links to appear like text (until hover) */ color: black; font-style:normal;

transition: all 0.5s; -webkit-transition: all 0.5s; -moz-transition: all 0.5s; }

/*Time for some hover effects*/ /*We will apply the hover effect the the lineage of the element also*/

.boxes li a:hover, .family-tree li a:hover+ul li a { background: #f4f4f4; }

<--simple charts-->

.family-tree * {margin: 0; padding: 0;
}

.family-tree ul {
	padding-top: 20px; position: relative;
	
	transition: all 0.5s;
	-webkit-transition: all 0.5s;
	-moz-transition: all 0.5s;
    display: flex;   
    xxflex-wrap: nowrap;
}

.family-tree li {
	float: left;  text-align: center;
	list-style-type: none;
	position: relative;
	padding: 20px 5px 0 5px; 
	
	transition: all 0.5s;
	-webkit-transition: all 0.5s;
	-moz-transition: all 0.5s;
}

/*We will use ::before and ::after to draw the connectors*/

.family-tree li::before, .family-tree li::after{
	content: "";
	position: absolute; top: 0; right: 50%;
	border-top: 1px solid #ccc;
	width: 50%; height: 20px;
}

.family-tree li::after{
	right: auto; left: 50%;
	border-left: 1px solid #ccc;
}

.family-tree li:first-child 
{ margin-top: 0px !important; }
.family-tree li:not(:last-child) 
{ padding-bottom: 0px !important; }


/*We need to remove left-right connectors from elements without any siblings*/
.family-tree li:only-child::after, .family-tree li:only-child::before {
	display: none;
}

/*Remove space from the top of single children*/
.family-tree li:only-child{ padding-top: 0;}

/*Remove left connector from first child and 
right connector from last child*/
.family-tree li:first-child::before, .family-tree li:last-child::after{
	border: 0 none;
}
/*Adding back the vertical connector to the last nodes*/
.family-tree li:last-child::before{
	border-right: 1px solid #ccc;
	border-radius: 0 5px 0 0;
	-webkit-border-radius: 0 5px 0 0;
	-moz-border-radius: 0 5px 0 0;
}

.family-tree li:first-child::after{
	border-radius: 5px 0 0 0;
	-webkit-border-radius: 5px 0 0 0;
	-moz-border-radius: 5px 0 0 0;
}


/*Time to add downward connectors from parents*/
.family-tree ul ul::before{
	content: "";
	position: absolute; top: 0; left: 50%;
	border-left: 1px solid #ccc;
	width: 0; height: 20px;
}

.family-tree li a {
	border: 1px solid #ccc;
	padding: 5px 10px;
	xtext-decoration: none;
	color: #666;
	font-family: arial, verdana, tahoma;
	font-size: 11px;
	display: inline-block;
	
	border-radius: 5px;
	-webkit-border-radius: 5px;
	-moz-border-radius: 5px;
	
	transition: all 0.5s;
	-webkit-transition: all 0.5s;
	-moz-transition: all 0.5s;
}

/*Time for some hover effects*/
/*We will apply the hover effect the the lineage of the element also*/
.family-tree li a:hover, .family-tree li a:hover+ul li a {
	background: #c8e4f8; color: #000; border: 1px solid #94a0b4;
}
/*Connector styles on hover*/
.family-tree li a:hover+ul li::after, 
.family-tree li a:hover+ul li::before, 
.family-tree li a:hover+ul::before, 
.family-tree li a:hover+ul ul::before{
	border-color:  #94a0b4;
}



.leftside {

   left: 0px; bottom: 0px; width: 50px; height: 100%; 
   background: url(<$macrocall $name="datauri" title="$:/plugins/cls/collection/bg-left-side-2.png" $output="text/plain"/>); 
   background-repeat: no-repeat; background-size: 100% 100%;
    display: flex;
    justify-content: center;
    align-items: center;
    overflow: hidden
}

.leftside img {
    flex-shrink: 0;
    min-width: 100%;
    min-height: 100%
}

title: $:/plugins/cls/mk/citation-picker

text:
|!Setting |!Value | |! Custom Help Path:|<$edit-text tiddler="$:/config/cls/mk/collection" field="help-path" default=""/>
When no path is defined help is opened at http://craigsturgeon.com/mk/help/mkhelp.html| |! MK e-book stylesheet:|<$edit-text tiddler="$:/config/cls/mk/collection" field="e-book-css" default="show"/>
When this value is not 'hide' MK will use the built-in stylesheets for e-books. You may want to hide this when you add your own e-book stylesheet tiddlers. | |! Filename prefix:|<$edit-text tiddler="$:/config/SaveWikiButton/Filename" field="format" default=""/>
This field, if populated on startup, will be used to determine a default filename when you come to saving your changes. Leave this field empty for TWs default behaviour. | |! Change Management:|<$select tooltip='Choose state of Change Management' tiddler="$:/config/cls/collection" field='change-set' default='disabled'>
Enabling Change Management allows you to optionally export a change set for each TiddlyWiki edit session.
Default setting: disabled| |! Citation Template:|<$edit-text tiddler="$:/config/cls/collection" field="citation-template" default=""/>
This field, if populated, defines a custom citation template. See help documentation for details.| |! Assertion Limit:|<$edit-text tiddler="$:/config/References/searchstrings" field="assertion-max" default=""/>
This field, if populated, defines the maximum number of assertion records to be listed on the [[Assertions]] page. Helps with performance when there are hundreds of records.| |! Citation Limit:|<$edit-text tiddler="$:/config/References/searchstrings" field="citation-max" default=""/>
This field, if populated, defines the maximum number of citation records to be listed on the [[Citations]] page. | |! Evidence Limit:|<$edit-text tiddler="$:/config/References/searchstrings" field="evidence-max" default=""/>
This field, if populated, defines the maximum number of evidence entries to be listed on the [[Evidence]] page.| |! People Limit:|<$edit-text tiddler="$:/config/References/searchstrings" field="person-max" default=""/>
This field, if populated, defines the maximum number of people to be listed on the [[People]] page.| |! Photograph Limit:|<$edit-text tiddler="$:/config/References/searchstrings" field="photograph-max" default=""/>
This field, if populated, defines the maximum number of photographs to be listed on the [[Photographs]] page.| |! Places Limit:|<$edit-text tiddler="$:/config/References/searchstrings" field="place-max" default=""/>
This field, if populated, defines the maximum number of places to be listed on the [[Places]] page.| |! Events Limit:|<$edit-text tiddler="$:/config/References/searchstrings" field="event-max" default=""/>
This field, if populated, defines the maximum number of events to be listed on the [[Events]] page.| |! Sources Limit:|<$edit-text tiddler="$:/config/References/searchstrings" field="source-max" default=""/>
This field, if populated, defines the maximum number of sources to be listed on the [[Sources]] page.|

text:
<pre>
<$set name="themecolor" tiddler="$:/config/cls/collection" field="theme-color" emptyValue="#195178">
<$set name="themeoppositecolor" tiddler="$:/config/cls/collection" field="theme-opposite-color" emptyValue="#E6AE87">
<$set name="themecolor2" tiddler="$:/config/cls/collection" field="theme-color2" emptyValue="#195178">
<$set name="sidebarbackgroundcolor" tiddler="$:/config/cls/collection" field="sidebar-background-color" emptyValue="#113955">
<$set name="sidebarcolor" tiddler="$:/config/cls/collection" field="sidebar-color" emptyValue="white">
<$set name="sidebarselectedtabbackgroundcolor" tiddler="$:/config/cls/collection" field="sidebar-selected-tab-background-color" emptyValue="#113955">
<$set name="sidebarunselectedtabbackgroundcolor" tiddler="$:/config/cls/collection" field="sidebar-unselected-tab-background-color" emptyValue="#0c2a41">
<$set name="ebookthemecolor" tiddler="$:/config/cls/collection" field="book-theme-color" emptyValue="#71382a">
<$set name="changesetenabled" tiddler="$:/config/cls/collection" field="change-set" emptyValue="disabled">

.tc-message-box {
 border-color: dark-yellow !important;
 background: yellow !important;
}

@media screen { .tc-topbar.tc-topbar-right { position: fixed !important; } }

@media (max-width: 750px) {
 .leftside { display: none !important }
}
.mk-pilltag {
 border:none; background-color: transparent
}

.pview img {
 object-fit: contain;
 width: 40px; height:40px;
 display: block;
}
.pview svg {
 fill: <<themecolor>> !important;
 width: 40px; height:40px;
 display: block;
}
.pview {
  float:right; width: 40px;
}

.column {
 float: left;
 margin: 5px 5px 5px 5px;
 width: 48%;
 text-align: left !important;
}
.row:after {
 content: "";
 display: table;
 clear: both;
}

.column {
 float: left;
 margin: 5px 5px 5px 5px;
 width: 48%;
}
.row:after {
 content: "";
 display: table;
 clear: both;
}

@media (max-width: 750px) {
 .column {
  width: 98% !important; }
}

.animatedtitle {
 text-align: center;
 color: #FFF;
 display: flex;
 flex-direction: column;
 align-items: center;
 justify-content: center;
 letter-spacing: 1px;
}

.animatedtitle h1 {
 background-size: cover;
 text-transform: uppercase;
 color: transparent;
 -moz-background-clip: text;
 -webkit-background-clip: text;
 margin: 10px 0;
}

<$reveal default=<<changesetenabled>> text="enabled" type="nomatch">
 button[title="Change Set"] {display: none !important;}
 a[href="#Changeset"] {display: none !important;}
</$reveal>

.pika-title {color: white !important; fill: white !important;}
.pika-label {width: 75px; overflow: visible; color: #FFF !important;}

button[title="Toggle TiddlyMap actions"] {display: none !important;}

.colour-edit { width: 50px; }

.tc-drop-down { color: white !important; fill: white !important;}

.tc-drop-down button svg.tc-image-button, .tc-drop-down a svg.tc-image-button {
 fill: white !important;
}

.sq-float-editor-menu { 
 background-color: #f7f7f7 !important;
 padding: 3px;
 box-shadow: 5px 10px 8px #888888;
}

.py-tabs.tc-tab-buttons button { fill: <<themecolor>> !important; 
 color: <<themecolor>> !important; 
}

.py-tabs.tc-tab-buttons button.tc-tab-selected {
 border: 0;
 border-bottom: 4px solid <<themeoppositecolor>> !important;
}

.pdfbutton { text-align:left; width:100%; font-size: 10px;}

.ct {
 min-height:150px; width:470px;border:1px solid #f1c40f;
 margin: 100px auto;text-align:center; position:relative;color:#fff;padding:15px;}

.ct span{
 background:#1D1F20;
 color:#f1c40f;
 padding:0 10px;
 font-size:20px;
 position:relative; 
 top:-28px;
}
.left_top, .right_top, .right_bottom, .left_bottom {height:30px;
 width:30px;
 border-radius:50%;
 border:1px solid #f1c40f;
 transform:rotate(-45deg);  
 position:absolute;
 background:#1D1F20;
}

.left_top{
 top:-16px;
 left:-16px;
 border-color:transparent transparent #f1c40f transparent;
}
.right_top{
 top:-16px;
 right:-16px;
 border-color:transparent transparent transparent #f1c40f;
}
.left_bottom {
 bottom:-16px;
 left:-16px;
 border-color:transparent #f1c40f transparent transparent;
}
.right_bottom {
 bottom:-16px;
 right:-16px;
 border-color:#f1c40f transparent transparent transparent;
}
.ct p {text-align:left; padding-top:-33px;font-size:18px}

.ct2 {
 min-height:150px; width:470px;border:1px solid <<themecolor>>;
 margin: 100px auto;text-align:center; position:relative;color: <<themecolor>>  ;padding:15px;}

.ct2 span{
 color: <<themecolor>>;
 padding:0 10px;
 font-size:20px;
 position:relative; 
 top:-28px;
 background:#f5f5f5;
}

.left_top2, .right_top2, .right_bottom2, .left_bottom2 {height:30px;
 width:30px;
 border-radius:50%;
 border:1px solid <<themecolor>>;
 transform:rotate(-45deg);  
 position:absolute;
 background:#f5f5f5;
}

.left_top2{
 top:-16px; left:-16px;
 border-color:transparent transparent <<themecolor>> transparent;
}
.right_top2{
 top:-16px; right:-16px;
 border-color:transparent transparent transparent <<themecolor>>;
}
.left_bottom2{
 bottom:-16px; left:-16px;
 border-color:transparent <<themecolor>> transparent transparent ;
}
.right_bottom2{
 bottom:-16px; right:-16px;
 border-color: <<themecolor>> transparent transparent transparent;
}
.ct2 p {color: <<ebookthemecolor>>; text-align:left; padding-top:-33px;font-size:18px}

.sourcetable td:first-child { font-weight: bold }

.tc-error-form {margin-left: 10px !important; }
.cuslabel {
 border-radius: 6px 6px 6px 6px;
 background-color: <<themecolor>> !important;
}
.cusbutton {
 -moz-border-radius: 6px 6px 6px 6px;
 -webkit-border-radius: 6px;  
 border-radius: 6px 6px 6px 6px;
 background-color: <<themecolor>> !important;
 -moz-box-shadow: 3px 3px 5px #535353;
 -webkit-box-shadow: 3px 3px 5px #535353;       
 box-shadow: 3px 3px 5px #535353;
}
.select-option {
 min-width:285px !important;
}
.tc-inline-style {
 color: grey !important;
}
.theme-background {
 background-color: <<themecolor>> !important;
}
.tribe-background { background-color: #ad482b !important; }
.py-actions button {
 background-color: <<themecolor>> !important;
 color: <<themeoppositecolor>> !important;
}
.py-btn {
 background-color: <<themecolor>> !important;
 color: <<themeoppositecolor>> !important;
}
.mk-aside{
 font-size: .675rem;
 font-weight: 300;
 color: rgb(250, 249, 246);
 float: right;
 padding-right: 10px;
}

.helptext {
 font-size:9px;
 line-height:normal !important;
}
.templateselector {
 display:none;
}
.templateselector h3 {
 font-size: 1.5rem;
 margin-top: 20px !important;
 line-height: 1 !important;
}
.mkTextEdit {
 /* width:150em !important; height:10em !important;  */
 width:100%;
}
.mk-private { height: 25px !important; }
.alert { color: red; }
.persontiddler {width: 40%;}
.mapit { display:none; }
.mappoints { display: block }

.person { text-align: left !important; position: relative;  }

.prow { height: 60px; }

[data-tags*="mapit"] .mappoints { display: none !important; }

[data-tags*="mapit"] .mapit {
 display: block !important;
}

.fieldtext {
 display: none;
 height: auto;
}
.fieldselector { display: none; }
.fieldlegend { display: none; }
.fieldset { display: none; }
.clstab { display: none; }
.hidetab { display: none; }

/* Tool Tips */

.tooltip {
 position: relative;
 display: inline-block; 
 border-bottom: 1px dotted black; /* If you want dots under the hoverable text */
}

/* Show the tooltip text when you mouse over the tooltip container */
.tooltip:hover .tooltiptext {
  visibility: visible;
}

span.tooltip {
 color: #00449e;
}

span.tooltiptext {
 color: #00449;
}

/* Tooltip text */
.tooltip .tooltiptext {
 visibility: hidden;
 width: 120px;
 background-color: <<themecolor>>;
 color: #fff;
 line-height: 80% !important;
 padding: 15px 15px 15px 15px !important;
 border-radius: 6px;
 font-size: 12px !important;
 /* Position the tooltip text - see examples below! */
 position: absolute;
 z-index: 1;
}

.tooltip .tooltiptext p { font-size: 12pt; }

.tooltip .tooltiptext .cit .citation .tc-reveal {
 line-height: 80% !important;
}

.citation-url a:link {
 color: gray;
 font-weight: bold;
}

.tooltip .tooltiptext {
 width: 250px;
 bottom: 100%;
 left: 50%;
 margin-left: -140px; /* Use half of the width (120/2 = 60), to center the tooltip */
}

.tooltip .citation-url {
 font-size: 11px !important;
}

/* add arrow to tooltip bubble */
.tooltip .tooltiptext::after {
 content: " ";
 position: absolute;
 top: 100%; /* At the bottom of the tooltip */
 left: 50%;
 margin-left: -5px;
 border-width: 5px;
 border-style: solid;
 border-color: #025881 transparent transparent transparent;
}

.tooltip .citation{
 font-size: 11px !important;
 line-spacing: 1
}

.twocolumns {

  column-gap:50px;

 break-inside: avoid;

</$set></$set></$set></$set></$set></$set></$set></$set>

/*  Boxes */

.boxes * { margin: 0; padding: 0; width:100% display: flex; }

.boxes ul { padding-top: 20px; position: relative; transition: all 0.5s; -webkit-transition: all 0.5s; -moz-transition: all 0.5s; display: flex; }

.boxes li { float: left; text-align: center; list-style-type: none; position: relative; border: 1px solid #ccc; margin:5px; padding: 5px 10px; text-decoration: none; display: inline-block;

transition: all 0.5s; -webkit-transition: all 0.5s; -moz-transition: all 0.5s; }

.boxes li a { display: inline-block; text-decoration: none; /* disgiuse links to appear like text (until hover) */ color: black; font-style:normal;

transition: all 0.5s; -webkit-transition: all 0.5s; -moz-transition: all 0.5s; }

/*Time for some hover effects*/ /*We will apply the hover effect the the lineage of the element also*/

.boxes li a:hover, .family-tree li a:hover+ul li a { background: #f4f4f4; }

/* pedigree charts */

.family-tree * {margin: 0; padding: 0;
}

.family-tree ul {
 padding-top: 20px; position: relative;
 transition: all 0.5s;
 -webkit-transition: all 0.5s;
 -moz-transition: all 0.5s;
 display: flex;   
 xxflex-wrap: nowrap;
}

.family-tree li {
 float: left;  text-align: center;
 list-style-type: none;
 position: relative;
 padding: 20px 5px 0 5px; 
 transition: all 0.5s;
 -webkit-transition: all 0.5s;
 -moz-transition: all 0.5s;
}

.family-tree li::before, .family-tree li::after{
 content: "";
 position: absolute; top: 0; right: 50%;
 border-top: 1px solid #ccc;
 width: 50%; height: 20px;
}

.family-tree li::after{
 right: auto; left: 50%;
 border-left: 1px solid #ccc;
}

.family-tree li:first-child 
{ margin-top: 0px !important; }
.family-tree li:not(:last-child) 
{ padding-bottom: 0px !important; }

.family-tree li:only-child::after, .family-tree li:only-child::before {
 display: none;
}

.family-tree li:only-child{ padding-top: 0;}

.family-tree li:first-child::before, .family-tree li:last-child::after{
 border: 0 none;
}

.family-tree li:last-child::before{
 border-right: 1px solid #ccc;
 border-radius: 0 5px 0 0;
 -webkit-border-radius: 0 5px 0 0;
 -moz-border-radius: 0 5px 0 0;
}

.family-tree li:first-child::after{
 border-radius: 5px 0 0 0;
 -webkit-border-radius: 5px 0 0 0;
 -moz-border-radius: 5px 0 0 0;
}

.family-tree ul ul::before{
 content: "";
 position: absolute; top: 0; left: 50%;
 border-left: 1px solid #ccc;
 width: 0; height: 20px;
}

.family-tree li a {
 border: 1px solid #ccc;
 padding: 5px 10px;
 xtext-decoration: none;
 color: #666;
 font-family: arial, verdana, tahoma;
 font-size: 11px;
 display: inline-block;
 border-radius: 5px;
 -webkit-border-radius: 5px;
 -moz-border-radius: 5px;
 transition: all 0.5s;
 -webkit-transition: all 0.5s;
 -moz-transition: all 0.5s;
}

.main {
 margin: auto;
 max-width: 900px;
 padding: 2rem;
}

.lead-text {
 margin-bottom: 60px;
 text-align: center;
}

progress {
 display: block;
}

.pedigree  {
 width: 100% !important;
 border-collapse: separate !important;
 border-spacing: 0 !important;
}
.pedigree  th,
  td {
   vertical-align: bottom !important;
  }

.pedigree  th { 
   border-bottom: 2px solid black !important;
   text-align: left;
  }

.pedigree  .bio {
   vertical-align: top !important;
  }
  
.pedigree  td {
   padding-left: 1rem !important;
   padding-bottom: 0.25rem !important;
  }

.pedigree .grand {
    padding-top: 2rem !important;
  }

  .line-bottom {
    border-bottom: 1px solid black !important;
  }

.cellname {
  position: absolute;
  bottom: 8px;
  width: calc(100% - 65px);
  left:15px;
}

  .line-left-down {
    border-left: 1px solid black !important;
  }

  .line-left-up {
    border-left: 1px solid black !important;
  }

  .line-left {
    border-left: 1px solid white !important;
  }

.edit-version { width: 50%; }
.edit-description { width: 100%; }

/*Time for some hover effects*/
/*We will apply the hover effect the the lineage of the element also*/
.family-tree li a:hover, .family-tree li a:hover+ul li a {
	background: #c8e4f8; color: #000; border: 1px solid #94a0b4;
}
/*Connector styles on hover*/
.family-tree li a:hover+ul li::after, 
.family-tree li a:hover+ul li::before, 
.family-tree li a:hover+ul::before, 
.family-tree li a:hover+ul ul::before{
	border-color:  #94a0b4;
}

.item-title {
   text-align:left;
}

.item-link {
   text-align:left;
}

.item-timedate {
   display: none !important
}

.kk-tl-kerman ul li {
   width: 85%;
}

.hideimages img { display: none !important;}

}

.sq-float-editor-menu {
	background: #fff;
	border: 1px solid #ccc;
	-webkit-box-shadow: 10px 10px 5px 0px rgba(0,0,0,0.35);
	-moz-box-shadow: 10px 10px 5px 0px rgba(0,0,0,0.35);
	box-shadow: 10px 10px 5px 0px rgba(0,0,0,0.35);
	border-radius: 5px 5px 5px 5px;
	-moz-border-radius: 5px 5px 5px 5px;
	-webkit-border-radius: 5px 5px 5px 5px;
	border: 0px solid #000000;
	max-width: {{$:/config/sq/EditorToolbar/width}}px;
}

.toolbar-config-all-btn .tc-btn-invisible.tc-btn-mini {
	display: none;
}

.toolbar-config-all-btn svg,
.toolbar-config-enabled-btn svg {
	width: 18px;
	height: 18px;
}

.sq-config-editor-toolbar,
.sq-config-editor-toolbar .tc-droppable {
	display: flex;
	flex-shrink: 0;
	flex-wrap: wrap;
}

.sq-config-editor-toolbar {
	max-width: {{$:/config/sq/EditorToolbar/width}}px;
}

.sq-config-editor-toolbar button {
	font-size: {{$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/metrics/fontsize}};
}

.sq-config-editor-toolbar .tc-droppable.tc-dragover > .tc-droppable-placeholder {
	display: inline;
	width: 2em;
}

.tc-droppable.tc-dragover + .tc-droppable .tc-droppable-placeholder {
display:block !important;
width: 2em;
height: 2em;
	border: 2px dashed <<colour dropzone-background>>;
}

.tc-editor-toolbar.sq-config-editor-toolbar > .tc-droppable:last-child .tc-droppable-placeholder  {
display: block;
width: 2em;
height: 2em;
}

/* lightbox */

span.cssbox_full {
  z-index: 2400;
  position: fixed;
  height: 100%;
  width: 100%;
  background-color: rgba(0,0,0,0.8);
  top: 0;
  left: 0;
  opacity: 0;
  pointer-events: none;
  transition: opacity 0.5s linear;
}

span.cssbox_full img {
  position: fixed;
  background-color: white;
  margin: 0;
  padding: 0;
  max-height: 90%;
  max-width: 90%;
  top: 50%;
  left: 50%;
  margin-right: -50%;
  transform: translate(-50%, -50%);
  box-shadow: 0 0 20px black;
}

a.cssbox_close {
  z-index: 2500;
  position: fixed;
  text-decoration: none;
  visibility: hidden;
  color: white;
  font-size: 36px;
}

a.cssbox_close {
  top: 1%;
  right: 1%
}

a.cssbox_close::after {
  content: '\00d7';
}

a:target ~ a.cssbox_close {
  visibility: visible;
}

a:target > img.cssbox_thumb + span.cssbox_full {
  visibility: visible;
  opacity: 1;
  pointer-events: initial;
}

span.cssbox_full {
  cursor: initial;
}

.image-no_drag {
	-webkit-user-drag: none;
	-khtml-user-drag: none;
	-moz-user-drag: none;
	-o-user-drag: none;
	user-drag: none;
}

/* Add Animation - Zoom in the Modal */
a:target > img.cssbox_thumb + span.cssbox_full  {
  animation-name: zoom;
  animation-duration: 0.6s;
}

@keyframes zoom {
  from {transform:scale(0)}
  to {transform:scale(1)}
}

/* Tab definitions */

.clslists {display:none}  
.clstest {display:none}  
.clstabs {display:none}  

<$set name="defaultDataView" tiddler="$:/plugins/cls/mk/css" field="dataview">
<$set name="urlDataView" value=<<getUrlParameter dataview "default">>>
<$reveal type="match" default=<<urlDataView>> text="default" >
<$set name="urlDataView" value=<<defaultDataView>> >
<$reveal type="match" default=<<urlDataView>> text="List" >
  .clslists {display: block !important;}
.clstest {display: block !important;} 
</$reveal>
<$reveal type="match" default=<<urlDataView>> text="Tabs" >
  .clstabs {display: block !important;}  
</$reveal>
</$set>
</$reveal>

\define addaction(value, tagg) <$action-listops $field="sourcetag" $filter="$value$ +[append[$tagg$]]" /> \end \define removeaction(value, tagg) <$action-listops $field="sourcetag" $filter="$value$ +[remove[$tagg$]]" /> \end \define addsourcetagbutton(tagg) <$list filter="[is[current]!contains:sourcetag[$tagg$]]" variable="hastag"> <$button style="font-size: 10px"><$macrocall $name=addaction value={{!!sourcetag}} tagg="$tagg$" />$tagg$ \end \define removesourcetagbutton(tagg) <$list filter="[is[draft]contains:sourcetag[$tagg$]]" variable="hastag"> <$button style="font-size: 10px"><$macrocall $name=removeaction value={{!!sourcetag}} tagg="$tagg$"/>$tagg$ \end \define showdatafields(taglist)
Click on data-field to remove it.
<$list filter="[tag[data-field]!has[sourcetag]] [tag[data-field]contains:sourcetag[$taglist$]] +[sort[caption]]" variable="customfield"> <$macrocall $name="revealcustomfield" field=<> />
Add any of these fields:
Click on data-field to add it.
<$list filter="[tag[data-field]!has[sourcetag]] [tag[data-field]contains:sourcetag[$taglist$]] +[sort[caption]]" variable="customfield"> <$macrocall $name="addcustomfieldbutton" field=<> /> \end \define addcustomfieldbutton(field) <$list filter="[all[current]!has:field[$field$]]" variable="hasfield"> <$list filter="[[$field$]get:field[caption]]" variable="captionvalue"> <$button style="font-size: 10px"><$action-setfield $tiddler={{!!title}} $field$="" /><> \end \define revealcustomfield(field) <$list filter="[all[current]has:field[$field$]]" variable="hasfield"> <$list filter="[[$field$]get:field[caption]]" variable="captionvalue"> <$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" tiddler=<> tag="input" field="$field$" /> \end \define replacement-icon() $(imageTitle)$ \end \define nontidexist(tiddler) <$button> <$action-createtiddler $basetitle="$tiddler$" tags="slideshowdefinition" text="" />Create slide definition for ''$tiddler$'' \end \define tidexist(tiddler) <$vars tiddler="""$tiddler$"""> <$list filter="[title[$tiddler$]] +[has[title]]" emptyMessage=<>> ''$tiddler$'' has been created. \end \define selector(id:"subsystem2id" tagger:"subsystem" field:"subsystem" label:"Subsystems" tagger2:"" originalvalue:"" dialogid:"55")
<$set name="datacount" filter="[all[current]each:list-item[$field$]count[]]">
$label$ (<>)<$button tooltip="reset $field$ to: $originalvalue$" style="font-size: 10px"><$action-setfield $tiddler={{!!title}} $field$="$originalvalue$" />Reset $field$
<$reveal default="0" type="nomatch" text=<>> <$select multiple field='$field$' size=<>><$list filter={{!!$field$}}> <$list filter="[all[current]each:list-item[$field$]is[missing]count[]]" variable=result><$reveal default="0" type="match" text=<>>
Select $label$ (<$count filter="[all[current]each:list-item[$field$]]"/> of <$reveal type=match default="$tagger2$" text=""><$count filter="[tag[$tagger$]]"/><$reveal type=nomatch default="$tagger2$" text=""><$count filter="[tag[$tagger$]tag[$tagger2$]]"/>)

Filter/Search <$edit-text tiddler="$:/config/References/searchstrings" field=dialog-search placeholder="type your search" tag=input/> <$button set="$:/config/References/searchstrings!!dialog-search" setTo="" >clear<$button tooltip="Add $tagger$"><$action-sendmessage $message="tm-new-tiddler" title={{$:/config/References/searchstrings!!dialog-search}} tags="$tagger$ $tagger2$" /> +

<$reveal type=match default="$tagger2$" text=""> <$select class="select-option" multiple size='12' field='$field$'><$list filter='[tag[$tagger$]search:title{$:/config/References/searchstrings!!dialog-search}sort[title]]-[has[draft.of]]'> <$reveal type=nomatch default="$tagger2$" text=""> <$select class="select-option" multiple size='12' field='$field$'><$list filter='[tag[$tagger$]tag[$tagger2$]search:title{$:/config/References/searchstrings!!dialog-search}sort[title]]-[has[draft.of]]'>

<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" tiddler=<> tag="input" field="caption" />
Enter the full birth name of person followed by years of birth and death in brackets.
Approximately <$set filter="[tag[chapter]contains:e-book{!!draft.title}get[text]split[ ]splitregexp[\n]!is[blank]count[]]" name=wordcount> <> words.

<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" tiddler=<> tag="input" field="birthorder" />
Enter the birth order. The birth order is the order for both parents.

<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" tiddler=<> tag="input" field="caption" />
Enter an alternative title to appear in search results, menu and graphs.

<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" tiddler=<> tag="input" field="date" />
Date in the format YYYY-MM-DD

<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" tiddler=<> tag="input" field="tweetid" />
tweet ID


<$select tooltip='Choose source state:' field='sourcestate' default='new'>
<$reveal state="!!sourcestate" type="match" text="new">Source has been added to collection and you have not started reviewing.<$reveal state="!!sourcestate" type="match" text="">Source has been added to collection and you have not started reviewing.<$reveal state="!!sourcestate" type="match" text="under review">You started reviewing the source.<$reveal state="!!sourcestate" type="match" text="reviewed">You have reviewed the source.


<$select tooltip='Choose type of source' field='type-of-source' default='Narrative'>
<$reveal state="!!type-of-source" type="match" text="Original">Original records were created to record a specific event. They were made at or near the time of the event and their informants were present at the event. Anything that is an accurate and exact image of the original document can be considered an original record, such as scanned images.<$reveal state="!!type-of-source" type="match" text="Derivative">Derivative records contain information whose informant was not present at the event. This includes copied, abstracted, transcribed and compiled information. In general, the further removed the copies are from the original document, the more likely errors have been introduced.<$reveal state="!!type-of-source" type="match" text="Narrative">Narrative sources are items such as a history book or a written family history.<$reveal state="!!type-of-source" type="match" text="">Narrative sources are items such as a history book or a written family history.


<$select tooltip='Choose type of information' field='type-of-information' default='Other'>
<$reveal state="!!type-of-information" type="match" text="Primary">Primary information are statements made by individuals who were a knowledgeable participant in an event or an eye witness to it. It was made at or close to the time of the event.<$reveal state="!!type-of-information" type="match" text="Secondary">Secondary information are statements made by individuals who were not actual participants in an event or did not actually witness an occurrence. This includes family oral traditions, abstracts and transcripts of records and online genealogical databases. <$reveal state="!!type-of-information" type="match" text="Other">Select other when the source does not fall under the definitions or Primary or Secondary.

<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" tiddler=<> tag="input" field="slidetag" />
Tag used identify the photographs that will appear in the slideshow
<$reveal text="" type=nomatch default={{!!slidetag}}> <$macrocall $name=tidexist tiddler={{!!slidetag}} /> <$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" tiddler=<> tag="input" field="footer" />
Text to appear as footnote on slideshow.

<$select tooltip='Choose slideshow animation:' field='animation' default='slidezoom'>
<$reveal state="!!animation" type="match" text="slidezoom">Slide animation will be zoom.<$reveal state="!!animation" type="match" text="">Slide animation will be zoom.<$reveal state="!!animation" type="match" text="slidedown">Slide animation will be slide down.<$reveal state="!!animation" type="match" text="slideup">Slide animation will be slide up.<$reveal state="!!animation" type="match" text="slideleft">Slide animation will be slide left.<$reveal state="!!animation" type="match" text="slideright">Slide animation will be slide right.

<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" tiddler=<> tag="input" field="divorced" />
Date of divorce in the format YYYY-MM-DD

<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" tiddler=<> tag="input" field="causeofdeath" />
Only use this field on a death event. This is a Title List of items that caused the death of the person.

<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" tiddler=<> tag="input" field="aka" />
Other names, including nicknames, this person went by. Use this field as a Title List whether you actually create a tiddler for each name or not.

<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" rows="4" minHeight="2em" tiddler=<> tag="textarea" field="description" />
Use this field as tooltip on trees.

<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" tiddler=<> tag="input" field="quote" />
Use this field for the quote.

<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" tiddler=<> tag="input" field="quotee" />
Use this field for the quotee.


<$select tooltip='Format:' field='quote-format' default='none'>

<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" tiddler=<> tag="input" field="icon" /><$button popup=<> tooltip="Select Icon" style="color:white" class="cuslabel">Select Icon<$reveal state=<> type="popup" position="below" animate="yes">
''Insert Image for Icon'' <$macrocall $name="image-picker" filter="[tag[$:/tags/Image]sort[title]]" actions=""" <$action-setfield $tiddler=<> $field=icon $value=<> /> """/>
Reference an image tiddler


<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" rows="2" minHeight="2em" tiddler=<> tag=textarea field="pdf"/>
Relative path to a PDF document.

<$button style="float:right; font-size:12px"><$link to={{!!pdftitle}}>View PDF TOC
<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" tiddler=<> tag="input" field="pdftitle" />
Short unique title of the pdf file. Leave this field empty unless you want to build a custom table of contents for the PDF document.


<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" rows="2" minHeight="2em" tiddler=<> tag=textarea field="youtube"/>
URL to youtube video.


<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" rows="2" minHeight="2em" tiddler=<> tag=textarea field="audio"/>
Relative path to an audio file.


<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" rows="2" minHeight="2em" tiddler=<> tag=textarea field="image"/>
HTML or WikiText for an image.


<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" rows="2" minHeight="2em" tiddler=<> tag=textarea field="thumbnail"/>
HTML or WikiText for the thumbnail image.


<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" rows="4" minHeight="2em" tiddler=<> tag=textarea field="photocaption"/>
Caption associated with image.

<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" tiddler=<> tag="input" field="caption" />
Enter alternate title for photograph.

<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" tiddler=<> tag="input" field="point" />
Comma separated lattitude and longitude of this place. Ideally copy and paste this from Google Maps. i.e. 90.000000, -135.000002

<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" tiddler=<> tag="input" field="what3words" />
Populate with what3words coordinates


<$edit-text tiddler=<> field=color type="color" default="#50966e" />
Colour of map pin used with Leaflet maps. This will not be used on Google Maps.


<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" rows="3" minHeight="2em" tiddler=<> tag="textarea" field="googlemap"/>
Not to be confused with googlemaps. URL to GoogleMaps that references this place. This should only be provided if point field is supplied.


<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" rows="3" minHeight="2em" tiddler=<> tag="textarea" field="googlemaps"/>
Not to confused with googlemap. This is an iframe that can be embedded in the tiddler.

<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" tiddler=<> tag="input" field="citation-title" />
Citation title.

<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" tiddler=<> tag="input" field="citation-year" />
Citation year.

<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" tiddler=<> tag="input" field="citation-author" />
Citation author.

<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" tiddler=<> tag="input" field="citation-title-of-source" />
Title of the source.

<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" tiddler=<> tag="input" field="citation-contributors" />
Contributors are introduced with their role (ex: Edited by, Translated by, Performance by,) followed by their name (First Last). Some contributors must be cited (editors, directors). Other contributors are optional (ex: performers, costume directors, screenwriters) and should be included if they are relevant to your writing

<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" tiddler=<> tag="input" field="citation-version" />
Version is used to indicate which version of a work was consulted (ex: King James Version, Kindle ed., 3rd ed., revised ed.)

<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" tiddler=<> tag="input" field="citation-number" />
Number (ex: vol. 6, no. 2; season 8, episode 5) identifies a numbered work in a serial or multivolume publication (ex: journal article, TV episode, encyclopedia volume).

<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" tiddler=<> tag="input" field="citation-organization" />
Publisher identifies the person or organization that makes the source available to the public (ex: professional organization, publisher, museum). Do not repeat the publisher’s name if it appears elsewhere in the citation.

<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" tiddler=<> tag="input" field="citation-location" />
Location indicates where to find cited information (ex: page numbers of a journal article, URL, DOI, or a physical location like a museum). Do not include https:// when citing a URL. Use a DOI or permalink instead of a long URL if available.

<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" tiddler=<> tag="input" field="repository" />
Repository...

<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" tiddler=<> tag="input" field="page" />
page...

<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" tiddler=<> tag="input" field="citation-url" />
URL of source

<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" tiddler=<> tag="input" field="url" />
URL of source


<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" tiddler=<> rows="6" minHeight="2em" tag=textarea field="citation-annotation"/>

<$edit-text class="tw-edit-texteditor mkTextEdit" tiddler=<> tag="input" rows="1" field="classification" />
Use this field to define classifications for the vehicles.


<$select tooltip='Choose type the type of evidence' field='typeofevidence' default='direct'>


<$select tooltip='Choose evidence strength' field='strength' default='weak'>
<$reveal state="!!strength" type="match" text="strong">The research has high confidence that the evidence is true.<$reveal state="!!strength" type="match" text="moderate">The researcher believes the evidence is accurate.<$reveal state="!!strength" type="match" text="weak">The evidence is questionable. It could be based on a narrative or an opinon.


<$select tooltip='Choose evidence information value' field='infovalue' default='incomplete'>
<$reveal state="!!infovalue" type="match" text="incomplete">Regardless of accuracy, there are missing elements in the evidence. e.g. supplies a year but not the full date<$reveal state="!!infovalue" type="match" text="complete">Regardless of accuracy, all the elements needed for an assertion are available.<$reveal state="!!infovalue" type="match" text="none">No evidence found (typically create this type of entry when evidence was expected to be found. Example: birth date on a memorial.


<$select tooltip='Choose evidence conflicting value' field='conflictvalue' default='unknown'>
<$reveal state="!!conflictvalue" type="match" text="unknown">There are no supporting sources or facts to validate this source.<$reveal state="!!conflictvalue" type="match" text="none">Does not conflict with other known sources or facts. <$reveal state="!!conflictvalue" type="match" text="discrepancy">A lack of compatibility or similarity between one or more sources or facts. Identify the types of descrepancies in the body of the text above; such as: spelling, names, dates, places and relationships.<$reveal state="!!conflictvalue" type="match" text="contradicting">Evidence that contridicts itself. Typically found in narratives.


<$select tooltip='Choose type the type of proof' field='proof' default='none'>
<$reveal state="!!proof" type="match" text="statement">Proof statement is a set of supporting points that prove a claim to be true.<$reveal state="!!proof" type="match" text="summary">Proof Summary is a simple recitation or list of quality sources that support a conclusion. It may be placed in a reference note. It might be presented as a standalone table. Or it might be woven into our narrative. The proof summary is appropriate when all evidence is direct and no evidence conflicts.<$reveal state="!!proof" type="match" text="argument">Proof Argument is a well-reasoned and carefully documented explanation of a research problem, the process by which it was solved, and the evidence that supports the conclusion. It may be long. It may be short. Length usually depends upon the complexi<$macrocall $name="selector" id="fatherid" tagger="person" field="father" label="Father" />ty of the problem. Typically, proof arguments are used when conclusions are based on indirect, complex, or conflicting evidence.

\define showno(spouse) Person <> has spouse {{!!title}} identified, but found [[$spouse$]] without <> identified as a spouse.
<$vars title={{!!title}}> <$set name="spouse" value=<> > <$button tooltip="Update spouse field for $spouse$" actions=<>> {{$:/core/images/link}} Update $spouse$ to reference <> as a spouse

\end \define nospouse(spouse) Person {{!!title}} has spouse <> identified, but [[$spouse$]] tiddler was not found.
<$vars title=<>> <$set name="tags" value="person"> <$set name="spouse" value={{!!title}}> <$button tooltip="Create spouse" actions=<>> {{$:/core/images/new-button}} create spouse <>

\end \define set-tags() $(tags)$ \define set-spouse() [[$(spouse)$]] \define actions() <$action-sendmessage $message="tm-new-tiddler" title=<> tags=<<set-tags>> spouse=<<set-spouse>> /> \end \define appendfieldaction() <$action-listops $tiddler=<<title>> $field="spouse" $subfilter=<<set-spouse>>/> \end \define showicon(icon) <span class="pview">{{||$:/core/ui/TiddlerIcon}}</span> \end \define prog(title) <progress value=<<getPersonScore """$title$""">> max="100"></progress> \end \define addbrackets(string) <$button class="tc-btn-invisible tc-tiddlylink"><$action-setfield $tiddler="$:/plugin/cls/mk/export" person1="[[$string$]]" /> <$reveal tag="div" class="cellname" type="nomatch" state="!!caption" text=""><$macrocall $name="getName" caption={{!!caption}} /></$reveal><$reveal type="match" state="!!caption" text=""><$view field="title"/></$reveal></$button> \end \define pedigree(name) <$list filter="[[$name$]]"> <div class="events"> <h3><$reveal type="nomatch" state="!!caption" text=""><$macrocall $name="getName" caption={{!!caption}} /></$reveal><$reveal type="match" state="!!caption" text=""><$view field="title"/></$reveal> Pedigree Chart</h3> <table class="pedigree"> <tbody> <tr> <th></th> <th>Parents</th> <th>Grand Parents</th> </tr> <tr class="prow"> <td rowspan="4" id="homePerson" class="person line-bottom"><$macrocall $name=showicon icon={{!!icon}}/><$reveal type="nomatch" state="!!caption" text=""><$set name="mytitle" value={{!!title}}><$macrocall $name="addbrackets" string=<<mytitle>> /></$set></$reveal><$reveal tag="div" class="cellname" type="match" state="!!caption" text=""><$view field="title"/></$reveal></td> <$list filter={{!!father}}> <td rowspan="2" id="Father" class="person line-bottom"><$macrocall $name=showicon icon={{!!icon}}/><$link to=<<currentTiddler>>><$reveal tag="div" class="cellname" type="nomatch" state="!!caption" text=""><$macrocall $name="getName" caption={{!!caption}} /></$reveal><$reveal type="match" state="!!caption" text=""><$view field="title"/></$reveal></$link></td> <$list filter={{!!father}}> <td id="Grandfather" class="person grand line-bottom"><$macrocall $name=showicon icon={{!!icon}}/><$link to=<<currentTiddler>>><$reveal tag="div" class="cellname" type="nomatch" state="!!caption" text=""><$macrocall $name="getName" caption={{!!caption}} /></$reveal><$reveal type="match" state="!!caption" text=""><$view field="title"/></$reveal></$link></td> </$list></$list> </tr> <tr class="prow"> <$list filter={{!!father}}> <$list filter={{!!father}}> <td class="bio grandDate line-left-down"> <$macrocall $name="prog" title={{!!title}}/> <$list filter="[tag[event]tag[birth]contains:people{!!title}]">{{!!date}}</$list> - <$list filter="[tag[event]tag[death]contains:people{!!title}]">{{!!date}}</$list></td> </$list></$list> </tr> <tr class="prow"> <$list filter={{!!father}}> <td rowspan="2" class="bio filter="[tag[event]tag[death]contains:people{!!title}]">{{!!date}}</$list></td> </$list> <$list filter={{!!father}}> <$list filter={{!!mother}}> <td class="person line-bottom grand There are <$count filter="[tag[source]contains:type-of-source[Derivative]search:title{$:/config/References/searchstrings!!source-search}sort[title]]"/> sources that are derivative sources.
Derivative records contain information whose informant was not present at the event. This includes copied, abstracted, transcribed and compiled information. In general, the further removed the copies are from the original document, the more likely errors have been introduced.

|Title |<$edit-text tiddler="$:/SiteTitle" default="" tag="input"/> | |Subtitle |<$edit-text tiddler="$:/SiteSubtitle" default="" tag="input"/> | |Description |<$edit-text tiddler="$:/plugins/cls/mk/settings" default="" field="description" tag="textarea" placeholder="Enter a description" rows="4" /> | |Default Tiddlers |<>
<$edit tag="textarea" tiddler="$:/DefaultTiddlers"/>
Use [[double square brackets]] for titles with spaces. |
<$macrocall $name=getreleaseinfo version=<> /> |TiddlyWiki version |''<>'' | |Memory Keeper version |''<>'' | |Memory Keeper viewing mode** |<$select tiddler="$:/plugins/cls/mk/css" field="dataview" default="List"> | |Print mode** |<$select tiddler="$:/plugins/cls/mk/css" field="printmode" default="e-book"> | ``` ** Memory Keeper supports a tab view and list view. The tab view provides a clean on screen presentation. The list view removes the tabs so the user does not need to click to view all the data. Enable the list view when exporting tiddlers to HTML. In this way, when you print the HTML to either a PDF file or to the printer all data will be presented. Select //e-book// print mode when you want to export tiddlers to HTML for use in an e-book, otherwise select //tiddler//. Hot keys: Ctrl-Alt-T (tab) Ctrl-Alt-L (list) ```

\define nospouse(spouse) Person <$link to={{!!title}}>{{!!title}} has spouse <> identified, but [[$spouse$]] tiddler was not found.
<$vars title=<>> <$set name="tags" value="person"> <$set name="spouse" value={{!!title}}> <$button tooltip="Create spouse" actions=<>> {{$:/core/images/new-button}} create spouse <>

\end \define set-tags() $(tags)$ \define set-spouse() [[$(spouse)$]] \define actions() <$action-sendmessage $message="tm-new-tiddler" title=<> tags=<<set-tags>> spouse=<<set-spouse>> /> \end \define appendfieldaction() <$action-listops $tiddler=<<title>> $field="spouse" $subfilter=<<set-spouse>>/> \end <div class="events"><$list filter="[tag[person]has:field[spouse]sort[title]]"> <$set name=ot value={{!!title}}> <$list filter={{!!spouse}} variable=slist> <$set name=per filter="[tag[person]search:title:literal<slist>!has[draft.of]sort[title]]"> <$reveal text="" default=<<per>> type=match> <$macrocall $name=nospouse spouse=<<slist>>/> </$reveal></$set></$list></$set></$list> </div>

\define copybutton(proband) <$wikify name=charting text=<> type="text" output=text ><$reveal type=nomatch text="individual does not exist." default=<>>Click on the button below to copy this to the clipboard. Paste into your favourite editor and save to an HTML file (E.g. Charts\sunburst-JohnSmith.html).

<$button message="tm-copy-to-clipboard" param=<>>{{$:/core/images/copy-clipboard}} Copy HTML for sunburst chart of $proband$ to clipboard<$reveal type=match text="individual does not exist." default=<>>''Proband does not exist''. \end \define selector(id:"" tagger:"" field:"" tiddlerfield:"" label:"")

<$set name="datacount" filter="[all[current]each:list-item[$field$]count[]]"><$reveal default="0" type="nomatch" text=<>> <$select multiple tiddler="$:/plugins/cls/mk/export" field="$tiddlerfield$" size=<>><$list filter={{!!$field$}}> <$list filter="[all[current]each:list-item[$field$]is[missing]count[]]" variable=result><$reveal default="0" type="match" text=<>>
Select $label$ (<$count filter="[all[current]each:list-item[$field$]]"/> of <$count filter="[tag[$tagger$]]"/>)

Filter/Search <$edit-text tiddler="$:/config/References/searchstrings" field=proband-search placeholder="type your search" tag=input/><$button set="$:/config/References/searchstrings!!proband-search" setTo="">clear

<$select multiple size='10' tiddler="$:/plugins/cls/mk/export" field="$tiddlerfield$"><$list filter='[tag[$tagger$]search:title{$:/config/References/searchstrings!!proband-search}sort[title]]-[has[draft.of]]'>

\end This tiddler will generate HTML code you can copy and save in a separate HTML file. Then define a chart tiddler to show your chart in MK. The chart will be an interactive ancestral sunburst chart of the proband. <$set name="p1" value={{$:/plugins/cls/mk/export!!proband}}> <$list filter=<>> <$macrocall $name="pedigree" name={{!!title}} /> |@@display:block;width:20em;@@ <$edit-text class="persontiddler" tiddler="$:/plugins/cls/mk/export" field="proband"/><$macrocall $name="selector" id="personid1" tagger="person" field="people" tiddlerfield="proband" label="Proband" /> | <$macrocall $name=copybutton proband={{$:/plugins/cls/mk/export!!proband}} /> To create a sunburst chart tiddler, tag a new tiddler with <> and put the text below in the text field. Be sure to change path_to_chart (and html filename) in two places in: ``` Open sunburst on a new tab ``` Then, below the iframe (with at least 1 blank line separating) add some text to help the reader, like: ``` This sunburst illustrates the ancestors of John Smith. Click on any individual to make them the main focus. Click on the background, white space, to return the focus back to John Smith. ``` Then associate the chart tiddler with those people in the chart. In this way, the chart will appear on those tiddlers (under the Chart tab).
title: Sunburst Chart Generator
